songs.title: Wasteland
songs.lyrics:
[Intro]
Change my attempt, good intentions

[Verse 1]
Crouched over, you were not there, living in fear
But signs were not really that scarce, obvious tears
But I will not hide you through this, I want you to help them
Please see the bleeding heart perched on my shirt
Die, withdraw, hide in cold sweat, quivering lips
Ignore remorse, naming a kid, living wasteland
This time you've tried all that you can, turning you red

[Chorus]
Change my attempt, good intentions
Should I? Could I?
Here we are with your obsession
Should I? Could I?

[Verse 2]
Crowned, hopeless, the article read, "living wasteland"
This time you've tried all that you can, turning you red
But I will not hide you through this, I want you to help

[Chorus]
Change my attempt, good intentions
Should I? Could I?
Here we are with your obsession
Should I? Could I?

[Bridge]
Heave the silver, hollow sliver
Piercing through another victim
Turn and tremble, be judgmental
Ignorant to all the symbols
Blind the face with beauty paste
Eventually, you'll one day know

[Chorus]
Change my attempt, good intentions
Limbs tied, skin tight
Self inflicted his perdition
Should I? Could I?
Change my attempt, good intentions
Should I? Could I?

[Outro (Only in the 2005 version)]
Should I? Could I?

description.plain:
Initially appearing as the opening track to 10 Years‘ 2004 album Killing All That Holds You, “Wasteland” was re-recorded as the lead single and 5th track of their 2005 album and major label debut The Autumn Effect. It became the band’s biggest hit, reaching #1 on the US Billboard Hot Modern Rock Tracks chart and #2 on the Hot Mainstream Rock Tracks chart. It is one of the slowest-rising singles to reach #1 at 27 weeks.

The lyrics, written by vocalist Jesse Hasek, were inspired by the struggles of Brad Renfro, his cousin and child actor who was going through a drug addiction at the time of the recording. He would eventually pass away in 2008, 4 years after the original release.

Three music videos were produced for the song. The first was a more direct interpretation of the song that was directed by Scott Lee and featured Renfro himself. This video can be viewed here:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gfV1RO80cjo

The second video was a more metaphorical interpretation that featured a fish flopping around on a dry lake bed and was directed by Chris Simms. This video can be viewed here. The audio from both this video and the previous one was taken from the original version found in Killing All That Holds You.

The third and most well-known music video was focused more on the social problem of human rights around the world and was directed by Kevin Kerslake. This video features the logo for the human rights organisation Amnesty International. It was nominated for Best Direction and Best Art Direction at the 2006 MTV Video Music Awards. Its audio was taken from the re-recorded version of the song found in The Autumn Effect. This video is the one currently embedded in this song page.

json.embed_content: Read “Wasteland” by 10 Years on Genius
json.title: Wasteland

album.full_title: Killing All That Holds You by 10 Years
album.name: Killing All That Holds You
